Use multi-functional furniture and appliances to maximize space and functionality. For example, a folding dining table that can also serve as a desk or a couch that can also double as a bed.
Incorporate vertical space by using shelving and cabinets that reach up to the ceiling. This will help to organize the interior and create a sense of depth.
Use natural materials such as wood and stone to create a warm and cozy atmosphere. This will also help to create a sense of stability and security.
Incorporate smart technology such as energy-efficient appliances and solar panels to reduce energy consumption and make the house more sustainable.
Use bright and bold colors to add personality and character to the house. This will help to make the small space feel more inviting and comfortable.
